Package model

Class Driver

java.lang.Object
model.Driver
public class Driver extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Driver()
    default constructor has a driver with a red car who drives on left lane Random UUID uniqueID and their vehicle is encapsulated inside a HBox by default.
    Driver(UUID id, String lane, ArrayList<GraphNode> listOfAllNodes, GraphNode startingNode, GraphNode destinationNode, Boolean displayBoundaries)
    Custom constructor where you can provide lane of the driver, and which node should start in the scenario, goal node and also provide all nodes in the scenario so the driver can calculate the shortest path, as well as a parameter that can let you enable or disable the view of the bounding boxes around the driver's vehicle.

    ArrayList<GraphNode>
    trackThePath()
    This method is responsible for backtracking the path, once the goal has been reached, this method is called It adds the goalNode, which is the currentNode because the goal has been reached to an ArrayList of GraphNode called 'path' Then it backtracks by getting the parent node and then the parents of parents etc until it reaches the startNode again All the GraphNodes of this route are added into the arraylist 'path', the order of the elements is then reversed so it can be converted into a Path for a PathTransition.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Driver

      public Driver()
      default constructor has a driver with a red car who drives on left lane Random UUID uniqueID and their vehicle is encapsulated inside a HBox by default. Also supplies the default driver with ChangeListeners that listen to the TranslateX and TranslateY properties and rotates the vehicle sprite based on the direction of movement of the driver. Additionally, a PathTransition is supplied to the default driver as well.

    • Driver

      public Driver(UUID id, String lane, ArrayList<GraphNode> listOfAllNodes, GraphNode startingNode, GraphNode destinationNode, Boolean displayBoundaries)
      Custom constructor where you can provide lane of the driver, and which node should start in the scenario, goal node and also provide all nodes in the scenario so the driver can calculate the shortest path, as well as a parameter that can let you enable or disable the view of the bounding boxes around the driver's vehicle. ChangeListeners also added that listen to the TranslateX and TranslateY properties and rotates the vehicle sprite based on the direction of movement of the driver. Depending on the passed in lane, the opposite of that lane will have all its nodes turned to solid nodes so the driver remains in the lane that they've been assigned.
      Parameters:
      lane - Lane of the driver - left or right.
      listOfAllNodes - A list of all nodes in the scenario
      startingNode - The starting node, where the driver starts from.
      destinationNode - The goal node, where the driver needs to drive to.
      displayBoundaries - A debug parameter that lets you see the boundaries of the driver's vehicle, can be enabled or disabled, true or false.

    • setNodesToDefaultState

      public void setNodesToDefaultState()
      Resets all nodes of the graph to a default state Default state means no flags applied such as Start, Goal, Current and each node has a default cost of 0 in terms of G, H and F costs.

    • getCost

      public void getCost(GraphNode n)
      This method calculates the G, H and F costs for a GraphNode, based on the start and goal nodes. This method is required so every driver can calculate their path from start node to goal node
      Parameters:
      n - GraphNode

    • setCostOnAllNodes

      public void setCostOnAllNodes()
      This method calculates the G, H and F costs for all GraphNodes in the scenario, based on the start and goal nodes.

    • search

      public void search()

    • autoSearch

      public ArrayList<GraphNode> autoSearch()
      This method is the core part of the A* Pathfinding algorithm, this calculates the path of the GraphNodes the driver must take to reach the goal node from the start node
      Returns:
      An ArrayList that can be converted into a Path that can be inputted into a PathTransition to allow the Driver to move along the path.

    • openNode

      public void openNode(GraphNode n)
      The openNode method adds a GraphNode to the openList so it can be evaluated. It must open the adjacent nodes of the currentNode, so that they can be checked to find the best node candidate that is closer to the goal node
      Parameters:
      n - GraphNode to be opened

    • fetchNodeWithXAndY

      public GraphNode fetchNodeWithXAndY(double x, double y, String lane)
      A helper method that fetches the Node from the routeList based on the X invalid input: '&' Y coordinates and Driver's lane
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the GraphNode
      y - Y coordinate of the GraphNode
      lane - Driver's lane
      Returns:
      The GraphNode from the routeList, if not found then will return a GraphNode of X coordinate 0.0 and Y coordinate 0.0

    • trackThePath

      public ArrayList<GraphNode> trackThePath()
      This method is responsible for backtracking the path, once the goal has been reached, this method is called It adds the goalNode, which is the currentNode because the goal has been reached to an ArrayList of GraphNode called 'path' Then it backtracks by getting the parent node and then the parents of parents etc until it reaches the startNode again All the GraphNodes of this route are added into the arraylist 'path', the order of the elements is then reversed so it can be converted into a Path for a PathTransition.
      Returns:
      path, an ArrayList of type GraphNode that holds the route of GraphNodes from driver's start node to goal node
